intro: Nephelea mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces vibrant purple or blue flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive if not managed properly.
